notebooks.title: Harmonic Oscillator
notebooks.description: In this example we have a look at the damped harmonic oscillator. A linear dynamical system that models a spring-mass-damper system.

notebooks.title: Linear Feedback System
notebooks.description: Here's a simple example of a linear feedback system, simulated with PathSim.

notebooks.title: Pendulum
notebooks.description: In this example we have a look at the mathematical pendulum.

notebooks.title: Van der Pol
notebooks.description: Here we cover a true classic from the world of dynamical systems. The Van der Pol system!

notebooks.title: Cascade Controller
notebooks.description: In this example we demonstrate a cascade control architecture with a two-loop PID control system. Cascade control is widely used in process control when a fast inner loop can help improve the perfo...

notebooks.title: DC Motor Speed Control
notebooks.description: This example demonstrates multi-domain modeling of a DC motor with PID speed control. The system combines electrical and mechanical dynamics with anti-windup control to handle voltage saturation.

notebooks.title: PID Controller

notebooks.title: Thermostat
notebooks.description: In this example we have a look at a thermostat, which is a kind off discrete regulator. It switches a heating element on or of depending on defined upper and lower thresholds.

notebooks.title: Coupled Oscillators
notebooks.description: This example demonstrates a system of two coupled damped harmonic oscillators using two ODE blocks.

notebooks.description: In this example we simulate a simple frequency modulated continuous wave (FMCW) radar system.

notebooks.description: This is an example of a simulation of a Radio Frequency (RF) network with PathSim.
